revised_title: Characterization and Properties of Ovorubin, a Chromoprotein from Gastropod Mollusc Eggs
tldr: The author studied ovorubin, a chromoprotein found in the eggs of the gastropod mollusk Pomacea canaliculata. Ovorubin has a high stability to denaturation and is partially utilized during egg development. The carotenoid component is likely an ester or ether of astaxanthin, and the carbohydrate component represents about 20% of the molecule. The carotenoid and glycoprotein can be separated and recombined, and the carotenoid is believed to stabilize the protein structure.
